question: In sajda after reading three times tasbeeh ,can I recite any Quranic dua or Ayats in Quran
answer:
QUESTION

Can you plz tell me that while offering the namaaz, in sajda after reading three times tasbeeh ,can I recite any Quranic dua or Ayats in Quran like Rabbi habli mins saliheen ,and Alhumma ajrni minan naar...My namaaz will be valid. or it will break ?

ANSWER


Share:

In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatoh

It is undesirable to read duas acquired from Quran in sajdah and ruku’. However, if someone does so, it will not render the salaah invalid.

It is permissible to read duas which are not part of the Quran and do not resemble the usual talking of people, in sajdah and ruku’. These duas should be read only in nafl salaah and those fardh salaah which are read alone. It is not advisable for an Imam to read them whilst conducting fardh salaah.

وتكره قراءة القرآن في الركوع والسجود والتشهد بإجماع الأئمة الأربعة ، لقوله عليه الصلاة والسلام { نهيت أن أقرأ القرآن راكعا أو ساجدا } رواه مسلم .

(Raddul Muhtar Vol.1 Pg.523 – H.M. Sa’eed Company)
Fatawa Mahmoodiyah Vol.16 Pg.323/4 – Maktabah Mahmoodiyah
Ahsanul Fatawa Vol.3 Pg.43/4 – H.M. Sa’eed Company)

And Allah knows best

Wassalam
